com.example.progetto

Class GetCSVfromJSON

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.progetto.GetCSVfromJSON

  • public class GetCSVfromJSON
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides method and attributes to extract the link of CSV that needs to be parsed from the JSON web link sent by Teachers. The file is downloaded only if it doesn't already exist in memory, thanks to method download

    • Method Detail

      • readAll

        private static java.lang.String readAll(java.io.Reader rd)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        rd - this input is used as a reference to the stream where we need to read characters, used in readUrlFromJSON
        Returns:
        a string containing the whole info got from the stream in input
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the read of a char from the stream fails

      • readUrlFromJSON

        java.lang.String readUrlFromJSON(java.lang.String url)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 org.json.JSONException
        Parameters:
        url - this input is used as a reference to a string representing the URL of the JSON where to find the CSV link
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the read of a char from the stream fails from the method readAll and also if opening an internet connection reading an inputStream fails.
        org.json.JSONException - if the parse files or doesn't yield a JSONObject

      • FindCsvlink

        private void FindCsvlink(org.json.JSONObject json)
                  throws org.json.JSONException
        Parameters:
        json - refers to a JSON Object representing the whole info got from the stream opened in readUrlFromJSON
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the parse files or doesn't yield a JSONObject

      • getlink

        public java.lang.String getlink()

      • download

        void download(java.lang.String url)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        url - this input is used as a reference to a string representing the URL of the CSV to download
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - this covers an I/O error that occurs when reading or writing and also a MalformedURLException that occurs if a protocol handler for the URL could not be found.
